column1: Linjiang (simplified Chinese: 临江; traditional Chinese: 臨江; pinyin: Línjiāng; listed as Linkiang on old maps) is a county-level city in southern Jilin province
column3: located to the east of Tonghua
column4: and not far from the border with North Korea. It is a county-level city under the administration of Baishan.

column2: there are totally twenty one Chinese films being shoot on location in Linjiang
column3: including Visitors on the Icy Mountain.

column1: Linjiang has a monsoon-influenced humid continental climate (Köppen Dwa)
column5: humid summers. Monthly average temperatures range from −15.3 °C (4.5 °F) in January to 22.3 °C (72.1 °F) in July
column6: and the annual mean is 5.57 °C (42.0 °F). Though the annual total is generous
column7: precipitation is quite low during the winter and rainfall is concentrated in the months of June through August. Sunshine is generous but falling far short of the central and western parts of Jilin; with monthly percent possible sunshine ranging from 42% in July to 60% in February

column2: six towns and one townships under the city's administration:Subdistricts

column6: Sidaogou (四道沟镇)The only township is Mayihe Township (蚂蚁河乡)
